subject: [C3 Extension] Run MATH C3 with mean pairwise cosine distance
description:
Generate MATH trajectories and C3 scores using mean pairwise cosine distance (better for free-form responses than categorical entropy).

Requirements:
- Dataset: MATH Level 5 (N=921 dev or 1383 test)  
- Use Vendi-optimized paraphraser (10 strategies)
- Same 4 prompts as GPQA baseline
- k=5 paraphrases per question
- Metric: mean_pairwise_cosine_distance (not categorical_entropy)

Expected: Better detection than GPQA (AUC >0.7) since MATH has free-form responses

Command:
```
python -m src.detection_game.cli.run_sweep \
  --config-name=math-paraphrase \
  'sweep.role_system_prompts.sandbagger=[aggressive/zero_accuracy_explicit,deterministic_errors/off_by_one,persona/second_guesser,deterministic_errors/correct_reasoning_wrong_extraction]' \
  trajectory.eval.limit=50 \
  dataset.hf_split=test \
  logs.dir=math_c3_baseline_$(utc_timestamp) \
  --multirun
```

Then extract C3 scores with cosine distance metric.
